title: Exploring-temperature-anomalies
text: vignette shows explore temp_data (annual temperature anomaly vs 1861â€“1890 baseline) reproduce main figure used app.

title: Exploring-temperature-anomalies
text: temp_data three columns: country â€” region name (e.g., â€œWorldâ€, â€œNorthern Hemisphereâ€) year â€” observation year temp_anomaly â€” Â°C relative 1861â€“1890 baseline Temperature anomaly time
code: head(temp_data) #> # A tibble: 6 Ã— 4 #>   country             code   year temp_anomaly #>   <chr>               <chr> <int>        <dbl> #> 1 Northern Hemisphere NA     1850      -0.0551 #> 2 Northern Hemisphere NA     1851       0.162  #> 3 Northern Hemisphere NA     1852       0.145  #> 4 Northern Hemisphere NA     1853       0.135  #> 5 Northern Hemisphere NA     1854       0.206  #> 6 Northern Hemisphere NA     1855       0.135 ggplot(temp_data, aes(x = year, y = temp_anomaly, colour = country)) + geom_line(linewidth = 1) + geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = 2, colour = "grey40") + labs( x = "Year", y = "Temperature anomaly (Â°C vs 1861â€“1890)", title = "Temperature anomaly over time" ) + theme_minimal(base_size = 12)

title: Exploring-temperature-anomalies
text: Values 0 warmer 1861â€“1890 baseline; 0 cooler. persistent upward trend indicates warming. Recent decades show sustained positive anomalies, consistent modern warming.

title: bushfireApp
